intro: Leandra pallida f. villosula, commonly known as the woolly leandra, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant features soft, hairy foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
